algorithm_technique: Iterate through the array. If an element is 0, flip the next three consecutive elements and increment operation count.
problem_summary_simple: Flip groups of three consecutive elements to make all elements 1.
problem_summary_technical: Greedy approach: if nums[i] is 0, flip nums[i], nums[i+1], nums[i+2]. Check last two elements for validity.
key_insights: The operation affects three consecutive elements. This suggests a greedy approach processing from left to right.
If `nums[i]` is 0, we must perform an operation starting at index `i` to make `nums[i]` become 1.
This operation also flips `nums[i+1]` and `nums[i+2]`. We need to ensure the last two elements can also be made 1.
